question: What is the maximum mortgage I can afford with an annual salary of $80,000 and no other debts?
true_answer: With an income of $80,000 and no debts, you can afford a mortgage with a maximum monthly payment of $1,866, assuming a 30% income allocation.

steps.content: What is the maximum mortgage I can afford with an annual salary of $80,000 and no other debts?

Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for income-based affordability calculation. 2) Confirm no other debts with credit_agent. 3) Calculate maximum affordable mortgage. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage affordability based on income.
Typical guidelines suggest not exceeding 30% of gross monthly income on mortgage payments.
Confirmed no additional debts in record.
Calculating maximum affordable mortgage payment based on $80,000 annual income.
Monthly income is approximately $6,667. Maximum mortgage payment is $2,000.
What about property taxes and insurance?
Retrieving knowledge on property taxes and insurance impact.
Typically included in the 30% guideline. Adjusted recommended mortgage payment to $1,866 to account for taxes and insurance.
With an income of $80,000 and no debts, you can afford a mortgage with a maximum monthly payment of $1,866, assuming a 30% income allocation.
